title: Detained Tufts student’s lawyers push for restoration of her student record
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The removal of Rümeysa Öztürk’s student record since her release from ICE custody has kept her from teaching and research opportunities.
Rümeysa Öztürk speaks at a press conference May 10 after her release from ICE detention in Louisiana.

Matthew J Lee/The Boston Globe By Darin Zullo December 7, 2025 | 10:47 AM 2 minutes to read Attorneys representing Rümeysa Öztürk, a Tufts University graduate student who was detained by federal authorities in March, asked a federal judge Thursday to restore her student record in an Immigration and Customs Enforcement database.

title: Felony riot charges dropped against Oct. 7 pro-Palestinian protestors, now facing misdemeanors
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The riot charges were initially added to misdemeanor charges that the protesters were facing, but have since been dropped.
Boston police officers detain a protestor during a pro-Palestinian protest.
Bryan Hecht/Berkeley Beacon By Darin Zullo December 7, 2025 | 9:58 AM 2 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Bill Simmons ‘more confident than ever’ Jayson Tatum will play this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Boston Celtics “From everything I’ve heard across the board, he’s been relentless and a maniac and passed every checkpoint.

title: 5 intriguing NFL matchups to watch during Patriots bye week
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: New England Patriots Multiple games on Sunday will carry major playoff implications in the AFC.
The Chiefs' playoff hopes could shift dramatically this week.
(AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) The Patriots won’t be taking the field in Week 14, but across the NFL there are plenty of important matchups that could affect the playoff picture in the AFC.

title: Pete Alonso reportedly has Red Sox ‘high’ on his list of possible landing spots in free agency
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Red Sox Alonso, who'll turn 31 on Sunday, is widely viewed as one of the top free agents this offseason.
Pete Alonso has been one of the game's top power hitters with the Mets.
(AP Photo/Lynne Sladky) By Conor Roche December 6, 2025 | 4:24 PM 2 minutes to read Pete Alonso seems to see a possible fit for him with the Red Sox.

title: 5 under-the-radar free agents that might make sense for Red Sox ahead of Winter Meetings
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Red Sox still have some needs to address in the field and in the bullpen this offseason after swinging a pair of trades for starting pitchers.
Harrison Bader had a solid 2025 season with the Twins and Phillies.
(AP Photo/Matt Rourke) By Conor Roche December 6, 2025 | 4:14 PM 4 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: How Patriots’ odds to win AFC East, get AFC’s No. 1 seed can improve in Week 14
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots control their own destiny in the AFC East race, but they might need some help to get the AFC's No.
1 seed.
Mike Vrabel's Patriots sit at 11-2 entering their bye week.

title: Review & setlist: Even in a show without Keith Lockhart, Holiday Pops brings seasonal spirit to Symphony Hall
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Concert Reviews Guest conductor Brian Eads led the Pops at Symphony Hall on Friday, while Lockhart and his contingent were performing in Worcester.
The Holiday Pops are back, having its first shows of the season this weekend.
Boston Symphony Orchestra By Marc Hirsh December 6, 2025 | 1:37 PM 5 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Here are the nations coming to Boston for the 2026 FIFA World Cup
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: World Cup Gillette Stadium, which FIFA has labeled "Boston Stadium," will host seven World Cup games.
Here's the updated schedule after the group stage draw.
2026 FIFA World Cup branding seen at Gillette Stadium in June.

title: How Craig Breslow views new Red Sox pitcher Johan Oviedo
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Red Sox acquired Oviedo in a trade with the Pirates on Thursday.
Johan Oviedo had been with the Pirates since 2022.

(AP Photo/Kareem Elgazzar By Conor Roche December 6, 2025 | 12:07 PM 2 minutes to read The Red Sox swung an interesting trade on Thursday when they acquired right-handed pitcher Johan Oviedo from the Pirates for outfielder Jhostynxon Garcia as part of a five-player deal.
